title: Flight Fare Forecasting
description: Are we able to accurately predict flight costs based on the route, distance, and seasonality? To carry this out, a Random Forest Regressor was employed that ultimately achieved a R-squared of 0.93 and a ~5.1% mean absolute pecentage error.

title: Textual Sentiment and Recipe Ratings
description: Can sentiment analysis of recipe descriptions and reviews help us accurately predict recipe ratings? Using a Random Forest Classifier, a ~72% accuracy was achieved and while this is not extraordinary, there is certainly a significant influence of textual features.

title: Image Processor
description: This project focused on constructing a simulated photo editting application using Python. Features such as birghtness adjustment, blurring, blending, and edge highlighting were implemented. Also developed a feature that classifies an image as day or night with a KNN Classifier.

title: Kaggle Data Mining Competition
description: Placed top 25 out of 100+ participants in a Kaggle competition where the objective was to build the best machine learning model to predict AirBnb listing prices.

title: Regression Analysis on News Popularity
description: Using a dataset with a heterogeneous set of features about articles published by Mashable in a span of two years, this project found 13 of the most predictive variabltes of new shares (popularity).

title: LinkedIn Salary Prediction
description: Are we able to accurately predict the salary of a certain job listing given its listing details? After intensive data-preprocessing, a Random Forest Regressor was employed that achieved an R-squared of 0.83 and a mean absolute error of ~$6028.89.

title: Personalized Genetic Report for Weight Loss
description: As part of an internship, I created a Python script that dynamically outputs a personalized PDF report on one's genetic traits related to weight loss given the patient's unique genetic composition.

title: Predictive Model for Restock Periods
description: In effort to help a startup company make better data-driven decisions, I built an Excel model that predicts the restock period of 34 products. I also created an interactive Tableau dashboard that visualized their KPIs and growth trends.

title: Data Visualization for Processed vs Unproccessed Foods
description: Created a spider plot using the Ploty package in Python to compare the average macronutrient composition of processed/ultra processed foods versus unproccessed foods. Here, the maconutrient composition is composed of protein, fiber, carbohydrates, sodium, sugar, and fat.

title: Meteorite Data Analysis
description: This project aimed to analyze the distribution of meteorites across the globe. To explore this, many analytical techniques were employed including visualizing the spread of meteorites using a global heat map to then calculating the liklihood of a sighting in every continent.

title: Market Research for the UCSD Craft Center
description: As part of Triton Consulting Group, I collaborated with a team of 5 students to help the UCSD Craft Center with market research. We identified opportunities to create new offerings such as one-day classes and also created a blueprint for a new website to better align their digital presence with what they offer.

title: Market Research for Tech Startup
description: Working in a team of 6 students from Triton Consulting Group, we created a Python script to web scrape for public companys' info. Using this information, we then formulated strategies to group and capture companys based on size and needs for serverless caching platforms.
